testimonials.quoteTitle: JEFFREY'S EXPERIENCE AT ARDEN COURTS OF ANNANDALE
testimonials.quote: "The bottom line, as a spouse, is I have peace-of-mind knowing my loved one is residing in a place with caring, dedicated people who enjoy their work and the residents in their care."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Jeffrey's Experience at Arden Courts of Annandale

"The professionalism and expertise shown by the caregivers and the nurses speak to the training, vision of the management team and the care that everyone on the staff embodies.The residents are treated with respect, compassion and love. Opportunities for residents to socialize, communicate and move freely around the residence increases self-esteem. The engagement and stimulation provided continues to create little magical moments of delight and fun for her.
The attractive community, caring environment, open door policy of management and continual communication from the nursing staff are so comforting and appreciated.
Arden Courts staff never hesitates to stop what they are doing to comfort and aide a distressed resident.
The bottom line, as a spouse, is I have peace-of-mind knowing my loved one is residing in a place with caring, dedicated people who enjoy their work and the residents in their care." - Jeffrey, husband of an Arden Courts resident

When it comes to caring for someone with Alzheimer's or related dementias, it is important to ensure they are receiving the right care, nourishment, socialization and supervision. Many senior living facilities will tell families they can care for individuals with dementia. However, they may not have the trained staff, specific programming, safety measures and knowledge needed to help residents thrive in their environment.

Learn more about how Arden Courts, a 100% dedicated memory care community, recognizes the importance of customizing a well-rounded care plan for residents with Alzheimer's or related dementias to help them thrive physically and emotionally. Our services and results extend beyond traditional programs.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF AVON
testimonials.quote: "From your activities director to all the aides on the cottage wing, all are extremely friendly, helpful and courteous."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Avon

Hello, I am writing you this letter to compliment your staff at Arden Courts of Avon, Connecticut. I have been a director of food services in nursing homes and assisted living facilities for 40 years and am now semi-retired and work for a company helping seniors. I have a client at Arden Courts, and from your activities director to all the aides on the cottage wing, all are extremely friendly, helpful and courteous to my client, as well as others there. My client was not doing well at previous assisted living facilities, but since he has been at Arden Courts, he is back to being the person when I first started with him.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF CHAGRIN FALLS
testimonials.quote: "We have peace of mind knowing she is now part of the Arden Courts family."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Chagrin Falls

As the former business manager for the Little Sisters of the Poor, a religious order of nuns caring for the elderly of limited means, I witnessed for years the high standard of care they demanded for their residents. Our mother previously lived at a well-to-do nationally recognized facility for three years before coming to Arden Courts. How fortunate and blessed we are to have found a third professional yet loving environment dedicated to the unique needs of our mother.
The administrative staff is very friendly and always willing to discuss the latest news of your loved one or quickly address any concerns a family member may have during a visit. From the welcoming nature in the lobby complete with punch and cookies to the colorful and stimulating stations in the central hub of the building, the visitors benefit from the positive energy present almost as much as the residents who live there. The lovely grounds provide an ongoing opportunity to leave the building without the resident having to exert too much effort.
The attentiveness of the direct care staff is evident in their constant interaction with all the residents. Mom had always been more of a solitary intellectual through the years, but in a short amount of time her caregivers found the right combination of people for Mom to dine with at each meal. She is more engaged at Arden Courts… Arden Courts also deserves the highest marks for the specific population they serve – those left vulnerable with dementia or Alzheimer’s disease.
While adjusting to her environment during the first week, I stayed during lunch to acquaint the staff with her eating habits. Mom always had more of a refined palate. She is very happy with the food, and we have peace of mind knowing she is now part of the Arden Courts family.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF CHERRY HILL
testimonials.quote: "We love the family involvement, open communication and active participation at Arden Courts of Cherry Hill."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Cherry Hill

We love the family involvement, open communication and active participation at Arden Courts of Cherry Hill. Because we are a “hands-on” family, we are very happy Arden Courts allows us the opportunity to be a part of all areas of his care. We are provided with updated reports on his progress, as well as areas whenever there is a need for changes to his care. Open communication and two-way dialogue are ongoing. Since there are no restrictions for visiting him, we appreciate and enjoy the flexibility we have to visit any time and are encouraged to participate in programs and special events. The family appreciates each and every member at Arden Courts, and we feel confident he is getting the best care.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF ELK GROVE
testimonials.quote: "We had peace of mind knowing Harry was being well cared for."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Elk Grove

This letter is being sent to you to express our sincere appreciation for the care of Harry, a recent resident of the Arden Courts of Elk Grove in Elk Grove Village, Illinois. We will always be grateful to the staff at Arden Courts for the unconditional care and kindness shown to Harry until his recent passing. When Harry first came to Arden Courts, he had a difficult time adjusting to his surroundings. The staff reached out to him, and eventually he considered Arden Courts as his "other home" and the staff as his adopted family.
We had peace of mind knowing Harry was being well cared for. Let me add that I became very attached to the staff and patients and miss my regular visits.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF FAIR OAKS
testimonials.quote: "Our lives have been blessed."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Fair Oaks

Lovingly dealing with an Alzheimer’s parent can be technically challenging and emotionally draining. That is why the choice of a memory care community is phenomenally important. We found that Anita runs an optimal community at Arden Courts of Fair Oaks. Anita inspires and directs her staff with clarity and purposeful service; she encourages and counsels family members through the difficult decisions and helps us connect to one another as well as to auxiliary resources. Most importantly, she creates a home environment where our parent can live her best possible life.
Our mother, Betty, resided at Arden Courts from October 2012 through October 2017. Her departure was precipitated by the need to move her to Virginia Beach with our father. If we could have taken Arden Courts to Virginia Beach, we would have! The five years we have collaborated with Anita and Arden Courts staff have included countless special events, large and small, accompanied by attentive care that truly extended beyond mom to the entire family. We send a heartfelt Thank You with profound appreciation for Anita’s leadership. Our lives have been blessed.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF JEFFERSON HILLS
testimonials.quote: "They are so patient and loving."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Jefferson Hills (1)

I am an employee with an in-home care provider, and for about the past six weeks, I have been going to Arden Courts of Jefferson Hills to visit a resident. I want to compliment the staff of Boathouse and the activities staff. I am so pleased with the staff and how they treat the residents. They are so patient and loving. I also am impressed with how the staff remains calm and interacts with the residents. I want to give the staff a big shoutout for their care.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF JEFFERSON HILLS
testimonials.quote: "The people at Arden Courts of Jefferson Hills were phenomenal."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Jefferson Hills

My mother, Teresa, was at Arden Courts Memory Care, Jefferson Hills, Pennsylvania. It was one of the hardest decisions my family and I ever had to make. My sisters and I took care of my mother by rotating in and out of her home for years prior to placing her at Arden Courts. The anxiety, fear and guilt that went along with that decision were immense. We were overwhelmed with the constant care of my mother and trying to care for our own families and work. My mother had Alzheimer’s, and watching her deteriorate both mentally and physically was emotionally difficult. At the time we made the decision to place her, she did not believe that her home was her home anymore.
The people at Arden Courts were phenomenal. From our initial visit with the intake staff, we felt that the folks there genuinely cared, and more importantly understood my mother’s issues. They were so patient and sensitive. Between the exhaustion and the weight of the decision, I know that we cried on them on more than one occasion. They were patient and understanding. They guided us through the process and patiently answered our myriad of questions. On moving day, there was staff to assist so we were able to move my mother’s things out of her home and into her new room while we took her to lunch with minimal disruption and added confusion to her.
I am a nurse, so as you might expect, I monitored my mother’s care closely. At no time did the staff seem threatened or insulted by my input. They were consummate professionals. I really felt that the family and staff were a team in my mother’s care. But most important was how they cared for these residents. I was utterly in awe of their ability to maintain such a caring attitude and have abundant patience in such a stressful, sometimes downright crazy, environment. Each staff member knew not only the names of the folks on their unit but also the names of all the residents in all of the wings. I watched staff take the time to console these confused souls despite them being so busy themselves. It wasn’t just the names they knew. They knew what these residents’ habits were and likes and dislikes. They always had a smile for everyone, even the ones who didn’t smile back or were ornery. I liked how they joked and teased with them. My mother loved that, and it made her feel more at home than like she was a patient.
Your facility was perfect. Everyone has their own room to go into when they want to be alone or use the bathroom, yet there is a dayroom to be with the other residents. The activities were great. It was also nice that the residents could say no to the activities. My mother was not fond of most of them but would attend some of the musical activities. The folks there were also amazingly patient with an often vocal one or two trying to disrupt the presentation or with the folks who merely go to sleep there. My mother was particularly fond of the street-like environment of the hallways. She loved to walk. Being able to have the freedom to walk a long distance there without interruption was great. The trick of course was finding her once it was meal time. And she did love meal time. Your cooks were the best. The food was tender enough so it could be chewed easily without being bland and boring. My mother often commented on how great the food was there. She ate more there than she did at home.
In the end, while my mother was in hospice care, I felt that my family and I were cared for as much as my mother was. Our ability to be at her bedside most of the time helped us to process her impending death. The staff’s responsiveness to her pain and agitation was amazing again given the environment. She would not have had as good of care were she in the hospital, I’m sure. My mother’s last months on this earth were full of love and compassion, and I can’t thank you all enough.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF KENWOOD
testimonials.quote: "The full staff at Arden Courts was beyond outstanding – friendly, understanding, professional."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Kenwood

I wanted to provide some important feedback regarding the recent excellent care for our Dad, Jack, at Arden Courts of Kenwood in Cincinnati. As a family, we’d worked carefully to be certain Dad would be all right following Mom’s death four years ago. Even at age 85, he continued to be very active and worked every day at his [insurance] office in Milford, Ohio. About two years ago, dementia began to creep into Dad’s day-to-day living, and it accelerated as time went on. We were able to move Dad from the home he’d been in for over 50 years into [a provider] in Milford for about a year and a half. Soon, though, Dad began to have more serious memory issues and had begun to fall from time to time. Arden Courts was then highly recommended for Dad, and we hustled to get him transitioned into the Kenwood facility; we had no idea how quickly he would decline.
The full staff at Arden Courts was beyond outstanding – friendly, understanding, professional. As a family, we were there frequently and always impressed with the sensitive care on the part of the Arden Courts staff. As things became more difficult for Dad, the Arden Courts group always knew the right thing to do, and this gave us great comfort. The final few weeks for Dad were very difficult for him with the dementia and congestive heart failure. Again, Arden Courts was able to compensate and make the needed adjustments, even when we needed to bring hospice help in the last few days. All in all, the entire stay and care for Dad could not have gone any better.
I know these comments are how each of the five children feels with respect to Arden Courts and the staff there. I sincerely wanted to pass on this feedback to the staff at Arden Courts and possibly for other families to reference, as well.

testimonials.quoteTitle: ANNETTE'S EXPERIENCE AT ARDEN COURTS OF KENWOOD
testimonials.quote: "My mother has been a resident of Arden Courts of Kenwood since August 2012. In that time, she has been blessed to be in the care of so many caregivers for whom their work is a labor of love."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Annette's Experience at Arden Courts of Kenwood

"My mother has been a resident of Arden Courts of Kenwood since August 2012. In that time, she has been blessed to be in the care of Janice, along with so many other caregivers for whom their work is a labor of love. Janice is gentle and caring. She manages each resident's routine with expert care.
Arden Courts also hired Becky who enthusiastically bonds with each resident. Every time I visit, I observe how she manages to discover and connect to the life of the individual resident.
A few months ago, Becky took note of my mother's love of Frank Sinatra songs. Early on, when mom was transitioning, the caregivers knew to turn on the CD player with Sinatra songs. Most who came to know mom have witnessed how she brightens up when Sinatra sings. Becky located Cincinnati's Sinatra, Matt Snow, who performs worldwide and secured an engagement for him to perform at Arden Courts. The Sinatra performer sand for an hour. My mother sat front and center, beaming throughout the entire show, occasionally singing a line or engaging with Mr. Snow.
I have Becky and Janice to thank, as well as the entire staff at Arden Courts. Thier essence of caregiving never goes away." - Annette, daughter of an Arden Courts resident

When it comes to caring for someone with Alzheimer's or related dementias, it is important to ensure they are receiving the right care, nourishment, socialization and supervision. Many senior living facilities will tell families they can care for individuals with dementia. However, they may not have the trained staff, specific programming, safety measures and knowledge needed to help residents thrive in their environment.

Learn more about how Arden Courts, a 100% dedicated memory care community, recognizes the importance of customizing a well-rounded care plan for residents with Alzheimer's or related dementias to help them thrive physically and emotionally. Our services and results extend beyond traditional programs.

testimonials.quoteTitle: ARDEN COURTS PROMEDICA MEMORY CARE COMMUNITY (LARGO) IS AWARDED BEST MEMORY CARE COMMUNITY IN CLEARWATER AWARD
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Arden Courts ProMedica Memory Care Community (Largo) is awarded Best Memory Care Community in Clearwater Award

Arden Courts of Largo is a friendly community owned by a not-for-profit healthcare organization. It specializes solely in memory care and is focused on the unique needs of seniors with Alzheimer's and other forms of dementia. The caregivers are dedicated to taking care of the everyday health of residents, but they're also committed to providing an environment that allows residents to truly enjoy life. This care is supported by a community layout with inviting spaces that are enclosed for the residents' safety. Starting with an initial assessment, each resident at Arden Courts has an individualized plan that can be changed as their needs shift. The caregivers at Arden Courts frequently communicate with families to find out what residents enjoy and how the community can make their experience better. Find out more about this award and more of our services here!

What Residents Are Saying

The son of one resident says, "She was home alone for many years thinking she was doing fine. Now she enjoys her life and many new friends. We know she is being well cared for and that is a great relief itself. Knowing she is having fun is a great bonus!"

testimonials.quoteTitle: ARDEN COURTS PROMEDICA MEMORY CARE COMMUNITY (LELY PALMS) BEST MEMORY CARE COMMUNITY IN NAPLES AWARD
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Arden Courts ProMedica Memory Care Community (Lely Palms) Best Memory Care Community in Naples Award

Arden Courts – A ProMedica Memory Care Community (Lely Palms) was designed exclusively for persons living with Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias. The community is comprised of four self-contained “houses” in which residents live in private bedrooms with half baths. Each house has its own common living areas, kitchen and full bath. All four of the houses share an activity and craft studio, barber and beauty salon and wellness center. The houses are arranged around a safe and secure landscaped backyard in which residents enjoy the beauty of the outdoors utilizing the sitting areas, courtyards, porch and paved walking paths. Residents can move about safely and freely throughout the community, indoors and outdoors, without feeling restricted. Liberal use of color-coded visual cues, photos and symbols, both in the courtyard and indoor areas, act as navigational markers to help residents stay oriented and maximize their independence. To learn more about the award click here!

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF MONROEVILLE
testimonials.quote: "I cannot tell you how many times I found the staff doing thoughtful things for the residents in the facility."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Monroeville

My name is Lynn, and I am the care coordinator for [a senior care] office. I go in and out of facilities as part of my job. I wanted to send a message about one of my favorite facilities that I go into on a very frequent basis – Arden Courts of Monroeville, Pa. I have been going there for my job going on seven years now. I must say that the staff there is not only efficient, professional and competent, but they make people feel special when you walk in the front door. I cannot tell you how many times I found the staff doing thoughtful things for the residents in the facility. They make an impact on these people’s lives. They are hands-on, and know and care about all of their residents. I truly could go on and on about what an amazing facility this, but I will end by saying I would recommend this facility to anyone; it is the best of the best in my estimation.

Arden Courts Receives Generous Donation from Local Supercenter

testimonials.quoteTitle: ARDEN COURTS PROMEDICA MEMORY CARE COMMUNITY (PALM HARBOR) CELEBRATES A HEART’S DESIRE WISH AND 100TH BIRTHDAY CELEBRATION
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

A Heart’s Desire Wish and 100th Birthday Celebration

Input string was not in a correct format.

At Arden Courts, we believe each life is a unique tapestry.  A distinct combination of moments, memories and ambitions.  And each person’s dreams, whether already fulfilled or still aspired to, are entwined adding to life’s richness.

The Heart’s Desire program at Arden Courts offers a chance for residents to relive a favorite memory.  For others, this program gives an opportunity to remember a cherished time in our resident’s lifetime or make a lasting memory with a simple pleasure.

For Arden Courts resident Nance G., her “Heart’s Desire” included all three of these experiences.  Nancy was born in Rhode Island and was one of two children.  During her lifetime, she married, traveled and enjoyed the company of family and friends.

Nance now lives at Arden Courts ProMedica Memory Care community located in Palm Harbor, Florida.  Nance is happy to be in Florida where she retired with her husband John who she was married to for many years.  She shares fond memories of traveling to Italy and enjoys good Italian food. 

While spending time with Nance, Memory Care Advisor Maryanne Fisher always enjoys hearing Nance reminisce about her time working at The Miriam Hospital of Providence, Rhode Island.  “When Nance talks about her job at the hospital, she truly glows.” said Maryanne.  Nance shows much pride when she speaks about her job at the hospital in addition to remembering the good times with the team.

In the winter when making one of Nance’s weekly FaceTime video conferencing calls to her niece, Joanne, the two ladies spoke about how to celebrate Nance’s 100th birthday in the spring.  It did not take long for them to decide that Nance’s career was one of the fondest memories she still has of her lifetime which is really no surprise considering Nance worked for the hospital for over 40 years until her retirement at the age of 65.

The two ladies thought it would be nice if Nance received an award from the hospital for her years of service.  Joanne reached out to Jeni Mowry, Manager of Volunteer & Customer Service at Miriam Hospital. 

What happened next was more than either Nance or her niece, Joanne, expected. Jeni inquired with the Lab Department at the hospital, wondering if anyone would remember Nance.  Past co-workers Diane Lee and Kathleen Peters along with many other team members said they did not just “remember” Nance but they kind of grew up with Nance and considered her both a mentor and friend. 

The team members did so much more than Joanne ever imagined.  They assembled a photo album for Nance which depicted the history and good times of the Lab Department where Nance once worked.  Nance will be presented with the album along with the opportunity to speak to some of the “girls from the hospital” as part of her Heart’s Desire and 100th Birthday Celebration.

If you are interested in joining our Heart’s Desire event on Monday, March 21, 2022, contact Maryanne Fisher, Memory Care Advisor, at 727-771-1600.

Arden Courts ProMedica Memory Care is located 2895 Tampa Road, Palm Harbor, Florida and is proud to be part of ProMedica, a mission-based, not-for-profit integrated healthcare organization which includes a network of 13 hospitals, 2,600 physicians, a health plan, 300 skilled nursing and rehabilitation centers, memory care communities, home health and hospice agencies. Driven by its mission to improve health and well-being, ProMedica has been nationally recognized for its advocacy programs and efforts to address social determinants of health. For more than 25 years, Arden Courts has been a proven leader in providing memory care services in each of our communities. To arrange for your personal tour or for information about our free dementia education events, contact us at www.arden-courts.org/PalmHarbor or 727-771-1600.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOW ART HAS TOUCHED MY LIFE
testimonials.quote: Learn how art has touched the life of Karin, an Arden Courts of Potomac resident.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

How Art Has Touched My Life - Karin

Karin is a resident at Arden Courts of Potomac, a memory care community. Her painting featured above, and in HCR ManorCare’s upcoming 2016 Heart of Art calendar, is titled “Docked at Tilghman Island.”

“I paint because I like to do something that makes me feel good. I don't do it for the money- I don’t really want to sell everything. I want everyone to enjoy it.”

Karin emigrated from Germany to the U.S. in 1955. She took up painting after visiting the National Gallery of Art, where she was inspired by the works of the Jewish-Italian painter Amedeo Modigliani. Karin is a featured artist and member of Potomac Artists in Touch (PAinT), a diverse group of local artist dedicated to cultivating the visual arts in the Potomac, Maryland community. She has worked mostly in oils. Her style includes impressionistic, expressionistic and abstract art, representing figures, still life and landscapes.

 

To learn how you can get a copy of our 2016 Heart of Art calendar contact the location closest to you.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF SEMINOLE
testimonials.quote: "Hats off to all the people who make living in Arden Courts of Seminole the best place to be!"
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Seminole

This is my second letter to inform you of how I continue to be pleased with the work that is being done at Arden Courts of Seminole. My mother, Elsie, is a one-year resident. I continue to marvel at the hard work and dedication these staff members and workers are committed to in caring for the elderly residents here. I am so pleased at how clean my mother's room and the entire facility is kept on a daily basis. I visit my mother frequently and see how quickly these workers attend to the needs of the residents. I have no fears or worries that my mother will not get superb treatment and care at this facility.
I am so relieved to know that the care my mother is getting is so good that I don't feel the guilt any more when I cannot visit with her. My mother's attitude and behavior reflect how comfortable she is in this facility, and she now calls it her home. I find this very comforting to me.
What can I say about the staff and workers here? They are truly the best! I continue to be welcomed into this facility and have all the confidence in the people who work here. I am so very pleased to have found this facility for my mother. Hats off to all the people who make living in Arden Courts of Seminole the best place to be!

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF TAMPA
testimonials.quote: "I will highly recommend Arden Courts of Tampa to friends seeking memory care services."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Tampa

My father recently passed away, but the last few months of his life were spent at Arden Courts of Tampa. I felt compelled to share my thoughts about the care he received. I spent considerable time and effort researching where we might move Dad when he needed to live closer to me. Taylor was very patient with my questions and helped me work through the decision process. Denise gave me a personal tour and provided great insight gleaned from years of experience dealing with dementia residents. David helped prepare Dad’s room and help me get what was needed to make it home for Dad. Tina was very reassuring as we transitioned Dad’s health care from Atlanta to Tampa. She kept me informed about any health issues.
Since Dad lost his independence in 2014, he was never more happy than his short time at Arden Courts. Your staff provided loving care and reassurance to me as I dealt with new issues while Dad’s dementia progressed. Taylor, in particular, exceeded my expectations in her patience and sincere concern for Dad and me. It was obvious the whole staff enjoyed their work and were skilled at dealing with dementia patients. Sylee is the caregiver who worked the most with Dad. She was always smiling and reassuring. She handled things I never could, and she enjoyed caring for Dad.
I will highly recommend Arden Courts of Tampa to friends seeking memory care services. The staff is what makes the difference. Denise has done a great job bringing in people who are skilled and enjoy their work. Thank you for allowing my family to be blessed by the staff at Arden Courts Tampa.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEART'S DESIRE - A DANCE WITH THEIR FATHER AT ARDEN COURTS OF WESTLAKE
testimonials.quote: Read about the heartwarming event the staff at Arden Courts of Westlake hosted for their resident, Mike, so his daughter's could have a "wedding dance" with their father.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Heart's Desire - A Dance with Their Father

Arden Courts of Westlake recently hosted a Heart’s Desire for one of their residents, Mike, and his family. Mike is living with advanced dementia and his two daughters, Julie and Hannah, may not have the opportunity to have a dance with him on their wedding days.

The staff at Arden Courts created an opportunity for the family to have these special moments. Mike was dressed in a tuxedo and corsage, his daughters wore dresses and got their hair and makeup done in the salon at Arden Courts. Both Julie and Hannah picked a song they would like to dance with their father too.

The Arden Courts staff also arranged for other members of Mike's family to share in a special dinner, complete with a champagne toast before he danced with each daughter. It was a truly special day that everyone will remember for years to come.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF WINTER SPRINGS
testimonials.quote: "I have had the peace of mind that my mother was being taken care of in the best way possible."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Winter Springs (1)

The purpose of this letter is to share with you my experience with the staff and operation of your Arden Courts of Winter Springs, Florida location. My mother entered your Winter Springs location just over six years ago after spending two years in another Alzheimer/dementia care facility in Ohio. She resided in the Winter Springs Arden Courts facility until her death just under two months ago. During this time, I made it my goal to visit my mother and the staff on a weekly basis and to attend the periodic special events they sponsored.
Throughout my mother’s stay at your Winter Springs location, I was continually impressed with the people, leadership and operation of the facility. The facility was run in a professional manner by a staff that treated all of the residents as family. They were attentive to details, took responsibility for any mistakes and persevered through the constant challenges. Throughout the past six years, I have had the peace of mind that my mother was being taken care of in the best way possible and that she was being treated with dignity and respect. I have often wondered what I would have done without your facility and the tremendous group of people that have provided care for her over the past six years. The care at this facility far exceeded the care that I could have provided in my own home, not to mention the challenges that would have been created for my own family, businesses and charitable efforts. I credit these positive attributes of the culture in the Winter Springs facility to the leadership there.
They are a group of people who care deeply about human life regardless of the residents’ ability to appreciate the care being given to them. They continue to provide the same level of care in spite of the resident being difficult or even hostile. I think it is fair to say that I am a better man for witnessing the selfless care the Winter Springs staff provided to difficult people over the past six years. I was both humbled and inspired by these folks serving in the face of sickness and continual losses, and I sometimes wondered how they could face death so often and yet remain so friendly and cheerful.
I have recommended Arden Courts to countless friends who are dealing with family members with the same issues as my mother had.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR ARDEN COURTS OF WINTER SPRINGS
testimonials.quote: "We would like you and your staff to know how much we appreciated the loving care given to my beloved wife during her residency at Arden Courts."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Arden Courts of Winter Springs

On behalf of our entire family, we would like you and your staff to know how much we appreciated the loving care given to my beloved wife Gail during her residency at Arden Courts.
Since her passing on January 9, 2016, we all have had time to reflect on how attentive your staff was to insure Gail’s comfort and well-being during her final days. Equally important was the genuine care and concern given to each member of our family. Additionally, your staff has helped each of us understand and accept that it is possible after such a prolonged illness that Gail is now without pain and has been given eternal peace.
Rest assured that all of you at Arden Courts will always be a part of the fond memories that will help us celebrate the life of a Beloved Wife, Mother and Nana.

testimonials.quoteTitle: THE FUN OF LEARNING NEVER ENDS AT ARDEN COURTS
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

The Fun of Learning Never Ends at Arden Courts – ProMedica Memory Care (Richmond)

Our ETT group visited the Science Museum of Virginia. The Science Museum of Virginia features four floors of interactive labs, awesome artifacts, and hundreds of hands-on experiences. We explored the Skin: Living Armor, Evolving Identity exhibit where residents learned about the skin’s role in shaping human culture and identity. The Speed exhibit was one of our favorites, displaying engaging demonstrations of the superfast to the incredibly slow, you can race an Olympic athlete or feel hurricane-force winds. 

Engagement is a term used in both love and war. It is a term designating the promise made before a wedding as well as a term objectifying battle. As we age, we are less likely to use the term unless we are looking for memory care for a loved one. Why then?

Because in quality memory care, engagement is the term used for dementia-specific life-enriching activities. As our loved ones’ brains change, their ability to participate in what once was easy changes as well. Traditional programs geared to interest are too generic for them. They are not truly engaged.

Research shows that dementia-specific engagement actually delays the progression of cognitive loss. Individuals with dementia engaged in an active lifestyle maintain cognition longer. An active lifestyle for an individual with dementia includes preference and dementia-specific engagement.

There are many memory care communities with a promise of engagement backed by a nice logo, but with little staffing, training or commitment. Walk through on an evening or weekend and see for yourself. An empty promise.

Whether it is Engagement Therapy Treatment™, or Namaste, Arden Courts’ focuses on optimizing cognitive strength regardless of where the individual’s skill level is. Matching skill, preferences and training to create a quality of life unrivaled by other memory communities.

At Arden Courts, engagement is much more than a promise. Plan a tour today to see it in action.
